lines.text: Play wi' me, Daddy!
Play with me now, Daddy!
You are Universally HATED, Grace! Loathed and despised by anyone who crosses your path. And none more so, in the end, than by me! I should have married Betty Montgomery!
[Dies of a cardiac arrest]
Does My Friend Flicker die at the end?
Jake, everybody dies at the end.

[Hides under covers]
Don't WANT to die! I want everyone else to die! Everyone else 'cept me and me Daddy!
I can't BE like you, Jamie! I just love you, you shitehook!
Just before you die you'll have an affair.

[to self]
Ooh, play with me, Daddy!
And this is your Mining Play?
No, this is the one about Anal Penetration among Ethnic Minorities.
How deeply fascinating...
Is it true? Are you as miserable as I am?
If you're in trouble, if you're in doubt; the Cisco Kid will help you out.
He was not a homosexual! He just loved his mother.
What's he like, the Italian?
He's Married. That's what he's like.
The Cisco Kid didn't come, Daddy.
Don't get caught, Jake.
I hate bloody writers!
You've been bang at it with the juvenile lead since the read-through!
A two-week run at the Edinburgh Fringe in a Space the size of a TOILET, and you think you're bloody *Chekov!*

Who do you think I am? What do you think I do with my life? I'll tell you what I do, I work for a living, I teach a bunch of masturbators English Literature - who think A Room with a View is a Chalet at Butlins and that a Gingerman is a biscuit - and I feed and clothe my children. Ha! My children! Have you seen my children? Have you? And I put on plays in Town Halls that nobody comes to see. And I put on plays in Town Halls that nobody comes to see in the faint hope that I will meet someone who might find me desirable and give me a damn good seeing-to!
I don't have to take this! I have CONTACTS at the Royal Shakespeare Company!
All I ever wanted was that land!
What a shame you never wanted something more. Like the love of a good family. Because when he'd finished with her, he started on me. And I don't think he'd finished with her, actually.
At least someone knows we're here. Welcome to Nursing.
But he mixes, doesn't he?
Well, he doesn't sit all alone in the corner and cry!
You never once found the joke funny. So I decided it wasn't a joke.
And I read palms at parties because when I was young and impressionable I read a BOOK on how to read palms and impress people.
But the Good don't die Young. The Young die Good.
Jamie is not a violent man, and I know that like I know the sun will rise.
I'm the Mary Quant no-one really knew.
I've told you, Elvis! Cut out the fatty food!
I got tired of fighting the good fight and losing.
And I've seen so many of them! Perfectly formed and clinically dead...

[doesn't know Jake can hear her]
But I want to have a child... that's better than Jake!
Where's the pause? That pause was my homage to Pinter!
You do know that this is an awful play you've written, don't you?
Mea Culpa, Mea Culpa, Mea Maxima Culpa...
